properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Buses will be in high demand so allow extra travel time. Avoid the largest crowds by visiting on a weekday instead. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sculpture by the Sea exhibition returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk for 18 days from Friday 17 October to Monday 3 November.

With around 450,000 people expected to visit throughout the exhibition, significant delays are expected on roads approaching Bondi and Tamarama beaches including Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. 

Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions will be in place.

Motorists should avoid driving through the area where possible or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time, particularly on weekends.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions:

  • Local roads in Bondi, Bronte and Tamarama will be closed at various times during the event including sections of Notts Ave, Fletcher St, Marks Ln, Kenneth St, Bayview St, Wolaroi Cr, Ashley St, Turner St, Cross St, Birrell St, Darling St, Silva St, Illawong Ave, Carlisle St, Rowland Ave and Wilga St. Access for residents will be maintained.
  • One-way traffic conditions will be in place on roads around the coastal walk between 7.30am Friday 17 October and 6.30am Tuesday 4 November. Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers and exercise caution.

Special event clearways: Strict parking restrictions will be in effect each weekend of the event on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 October, Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 October and Saturday 1 and Sunday 2 November at the following times and locations:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd between Old South Head and opposite Sandridge St at Bondi Beach (northern side)
  • 12pm midday to 7pm: Bondi Rd between Sandridge St at Bondi Beach and Oxford St at Bondi Junction (southern side)
  • 8am to 4pm: Campbell Pde between Queen Elizabeth Drive and Beach Rd at Bondi Beach (Eastern side)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures 

Vehicle access for local residents will be maintained for the duration of the road closures. Traffic controllers will be on site to permit access to properties. 

  • 7:30am - 6:30pm Daily (Fri 17 Oct - Mon 3 Nov): Notts Ave, Rowland Ave, Silva St, Wilga St. 
  • 7:30am - 6:30pm Weekends Only (18-19 Oct, 25-26 Oct, 1-2 Nov): Wolaroi Cres 
  • 7:30am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30pm Mon 3 Nov: Carlisle St, Fletcher St, Kenneth St, Marks Ln (one-way southbound traffic only) 
  • 10am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30pm Mon 3 Nov: Ashley St, Bayview St, Illawong Ave 

One-way traffic changes 

The following roads will become one-way only, for the duration of the event: 

7:30am - 6:30pm Daily (Fri 17 Oct – Mon 3 Nov) 

  • Bayview St closed southbound from Hewlett St to Bronte Marine Dr. Northbound traffic only. 

6:30am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30am Tue 4 Nov 

  • Dellview St closed southbound from Fletcher St to Pacific Ave. Northbound traffic only. 
  • Gaerloch Ave closed eastbound and northbound from Dellview St to Alexander St. Southbound traffic only. 
  • Thompson St closed eastbound from Ashley St to Mirimar Ave. Westbound traffic only.  

10am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30pm Mon 3 Nov 

  • Birrell St closed eastbound from Tamarama St to Cross St. 
  • Cross St closed southbound from Birrell St to Turner St. Northbound traffic only. 
  • Darling St closed eastbound from Alfred St to Ashley St. Westbound traffic only. 
  • Mirimar Ave closed southbound from Thompson St to Hewlett St. Northbound traffic only. 
  • Turner St closed eastbound from Cross St to Ashley St. Westbound traffic only.
arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Changed traffic conditions

properties.publicTransport: Route 478 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Greek Festival will be taking place on Bay St on Sunday 16 Nov. Road closures and parking restrictions will be in effect.

Motorist are advised to allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

From 2am Sunday 16 Nov to 3am Monday 17 Nov the following roads will be closed:

  • Bay St between Queens Rd and The Grand Pde
  • Bay St between Crawford St and Queens Rd (Eastbound lanes)
  • Moate Ave between Bay St and Saywell Ln

Motorists travelling on The Grand Parade will be detoured via local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 2am Sunday 16 Nov until 3am Monday 17 Nov on sections of Moate St and Bay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

From 2am Sunday 16 Nov to 3am Monday 17 Nov

  • Bay Street between Queens Road and The Grand Parade
  • Bay Street between Crawford Street and Queens Road (Eastbound)
  • Moate Avenue between Bay Street and Saywell Lane

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

From 2am Sunday 16 Nov to 3am Monday 17 Nov

  • Bay Street between Queens Street and The Grand Parade (Both sides)
  • Moate Avenue between Bay Street and Saywell Lane (Both sides)

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 370, 431 and 433 will be diverting around road closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Glebe Point Rd. The event runs from 11am until 8pm.

The following roads will close from 7am to 11.30pm

  • Glebe Point Rd between St Johns Rd and Broadway, and adjoining roads including sections of Cowper St, Derwent Ln, Derby Pl, Francis St, Mitchell St and Norton St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity. Police may restrict vehicle access along closed roads, including residents and businesses.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 9:30pm on sections of Glebe Point Rd, Francis St, Derby Pl, Cowper St, Norton St and Mitchell St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Carnival: Big Dance on Cup Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse on Tuesday 4 November. First race at 11.45am, last race at 6.05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the event, particularly in the evening during the weeknight peak.

The right-turn bay into Randwick Racecourse gate 1 on Alison Road (eastbound) will be closed. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special Event Clearways 

Special event clearways will be in place at the following times and locations: 

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and the Grand Drive roundabout (western side) 
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and the roundabout at the entry to Randwick Racecourse (both sides) 
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between Gate Two Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern sides) 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Nitro Circus 'Off The Rails' at McDonald Jones Stadium. Show starts at 7.30pm, finishes around 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the show. Allow extra travel time on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow.

For passenger drop-off, use the allocated 10-minute loading zone in the McDonald Jones Stadium car park. Entry is via the driveway off Turton Road.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

arrangementElements.html:
SATURDAY 2 AUGUST

Gates open at 11.15am

Titans v Bulldogs at 12.15pm

Wests Tigers v Roosters at 2.15pm

Finish around 6.15pm

SUNDAY 3 AUGUST

Gates open 10.50am

Cowboys v Warriors at 11.50am

Finish around 5.45pm.

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Carnival - Ladies Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11.30am, last race from 6.05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the racecourse as attendees travel to and from the event. Allow extra travel time on roads including James Ruse Drive and Hassall St.   

Drivers are reminded that light rail services are running between Westmead, Parramatta and Carlingford. Trams can’t stop quickly or easily – so exercise extra caution when driving in the area.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 7am to 8pm on Grand Avenue from approx. 100m prior to Gate 1 Australian Turf Club Rosehill Gardens to opposite Grand Avenue North.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

A-League Men: Sydney FC v Macarthur FC at Leichhardt Oval on Sunday. Kick-off 3pm, full time at 4.45pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James St, Perry St, Balmain Rd, Mary St and Glover St as attendees travel to and from the match.

A section of Mary Street may close before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area. Traffic will be detoured via Chapel Street while the closure is in place.   

Motorists requiring access to other venues in the park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Nitro Circus 'Off The Rails' World Tour at WIN Stadium. Show starts at 7.30pm, finishes around 9.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads as fans travel to the show in the already busy evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the show for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NBL: Sydney Kings v New Zealand Breakers at Qudos Bank Arena on Sunday. Match starts at 4.15pm and finishes 6.15pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as attendees travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Roads may be closed in the precinct, for closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map for more details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Buses will divert while roads are closed after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Pacific Championship Finals at CommBank Stadium on Sunday. First game starts at 11.35am and last match finishes around 5.50pm.

With up to 20,000 people expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Parramatta and nearby car parks are expected to be in high demand.

Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Drivers are reminded that light rail services are running through Parramatta CBD. Trams can’t stop quickly or easily – so exercise extra caution when driving in the area. 

Road closures 

Roads around the stadium will close from 5.50pm to 6.20pm approx. to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell Street from Grose Street to George Street 
  • Ross Street from O’Connell Street to Trott Street 
  • Victoria Road from O’Connell Street to Villiers Street 

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose Street, Brickfield Street, Victoria Road and Wilde Avenue in both directions.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Santa's Sydney Sleigh Ride in the Sydney CBD. Events start from 6.30pm and the Sleigh Ride will start at Customs House Square near Circular Quay at 8.10pm, travel along Pitt St and arrive at Martin Pl at approx. 8.20pm. The sleigh will then leave Martin Pl at 8.35pm, arriving at Town Hall at 8.45pm.

The following road closures will be in place from 5pm to 10.30pm to safely facilitate the event:

  • Pitt St between Hunter St and King St
  • Hunter St between Castlereagh St and Pitt St (westbound)

Managed access to Pitt St car parks will be maintained via contra flow conditions from Hunter St to Martin Pl and from King St to Martin Pl. Vehicles cannot cross Martin Place on Pitt Street.

Traffic in the CBD on approach to Pitt St will be heavy before, during and after the event. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
Road Closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopened after infrastructure removal and cleaning.

SYDNEY CBD - FROM 5PM TO 10.30PM

  • Hunter St* between Castlereagh St and Pitt St (westbound)
  • Pitt St^ between Hunter St and King St

*Local traffic access only (vehicles making deliveries or accessing Hunter St car parks).

^Managed access to Pitt St car parks (e.g. Angel Pl, Fullerton Hotel car park, Secure car park, Wilson car park, Telstra Broadcast Building car park) will be maintained via contra flow conditions from Hunter St to Martin Pl and from King Street to Martin Place. Vehicles cannot cross Martin Pl on Pitt St.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.otherAdvice:
800 riders are expected to take part in the inaugural Vic100 cycle ride travelling 100km from Penrith to Mount Victoria via Bells Line of Road. Closures will be in place along parts of the course, while on other sections cyclists will share roads with motorists. The ride starts from Tench Reserve in Jamisontown, near Penrith, and finishes at the Victoria and Albert Guest House in Mount Victoria. 

Road closures

Roads will be closed between 6.30am and 12pm along parts of the course including Bells Line of Road. Some roads around the start area in Penrith will close from 4.30am and some roads around the finish area in Mount Victoria will remain closed til 4pm near the finish line.

Bells Line of Rd closures:

  • Bells Line of Road will be closed between Bell and Kurrajong between 6.30am and midday. The road will reopen in stages with access reopened by 10am from Kurrajong and Bilpin, and 12pm from Bell.
  • Motorists travelling between Lithgow and Sydney on Sunday morning will need to use the Great Western Highway instead.
  • Bells Line of Rd closed in both directions between Kurrajong, Old Bells Line of Rd and Bilpin, Valley Ridges Rd from 7am to 10am.
  • From Bell, no access to Bells Line of Rd from 6.30am until 12pm midday.
  • From Bilpin, westbound access towards Bell closed 7am until midday, eastbound access towards Kurrajong closed 7am to 10am.
  • Local access: Cyclists will be travelling from Kurrajong to Bell in the westbound lane of Bells Line of Rd. Local traffic from properties along Bells Line of Rd needing to exit while the event is underway will be permitted to travel in the eastbound lane only, under direction of traffic control and under a reduced 40km/h speed limit.

Darling Causeway closures:

  • The Darling Causeway will be closed from Bell to Mount Victoria from 9.30am to 12.30pm. 
  • During this time, motorists from Lithgow or Dargan can travel eastbound as far as Bell then will get turned around to return westbound back towards Lithgow. Motorists travelling between Mount Victoria and Lithgow can use the Great Western Hwy.

Local closures - Kurrajong, Jamistown and Mount Victoria:

  • 4:30am to 8am sections of Jamison Rd and Tench Ave
  • 5:45am to 8:30am sections of Old Kurrajong Rd, Crowleys Ln and Yarramundi Ln
  • 6am to 9.30am Old Bells Line of Road northbound between Grose Vale Road and Bells Line of Road
  • Between 9.30am and 4pm sections of Station St and Harley Ave near Mount Victoria station

arrangementElements.html:

properties.diversions: Motorists travelling between Lithgow and Sydney on Sunday between 6.30am and 12pm will need to use the Great Western Highway instead while Bells Line of Rd is closed.

properties.otherAdvice: The Newell Highway will be closed at the Clock Tower round-a-bout (Dalgarno St) for 15 minutes whilst the service is conducted.
properties.diversions: Detour for all vehicles (both directions) via Edwards St, Namoi St, Saleyards Rd and Gardener St.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Oasis Live '25 concerts at Accor Stadium on Friday 7 and Saturday 8 November. Gates open from 6pm, concert finishes around 10.45pm each night.

With around 70,000 concert-goers expected at each show, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • PARKING: Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking. Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space as parking will be in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time. Significant traffic delays are expected, especially on Friday during the busy evening peak.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event and to accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League double header at polytec Stadium. Central Coast Mariners women v Adelaide United at 2.15pm. Central Coast Mariners men v Wellington Phoenix at 5pm, finish approx. 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the stadium. Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed from 1.30pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Ghost in The Rocks festival in Circular Quay and The Rocks precincts from Thursday 30 October until Sunday 2 November. Event runs from 4pm until 11pm on Thursday and Friday; 12pm until 11pm on Saturday & 12pm until 10pm on Sunday.

Events will be held at First Fleet Park, Tallawoladah Lawn, George Street Alfresco Area, and throughout The Rocks precinct including at Jack Mundy, Argyle Street, Playfair Street, Foundation Park, Atherden Street, Kendall Lane alleyways and Cadmans Cottage.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and to be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

TWICE at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday 1 and Sunday 2 November. Show starts nightly at 7pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

  • Chalmers St, western side, between Cleveland St and Devonshire St, and
  • Chalmers St, eastern side, between Cleveland St and Rutland St.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Metallica concert at Accor Stadium on Saturday 15 November. Gates open from 5pm, concert finishes around 11pm.

With around 70,000 concert-goers expected, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • PARKING: Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking. Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space as parking will be in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time. Significant traffic delays are expected.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

From 8.00am Saturday 15 November – 3.00am Sunday 16 November 

  • Kevin Coombs Avenue between Pondage Link and Australia Avenue (eastbound)
  • Kevin Coombs Avenue between Pondage Link and Australia Avenue (westbound)
  • Holker Busway from Hill Road to Australia Avenue

From 9.00am Saturday 15 November – 3.00am Sunday 16 November 

  • Shirley Strickland Avenue between P4 Roundabout and Rod Laver Avenue.
  • Rod Laver Drive at the rear of Tennis Centre back to Shirley Strickland Avenue West

From 10.00am Saturday 15 November – 3.00am Sunday 16 November 

  • Olympic Boulevard between Sarah Durack Avenue and Herb Elliott Avenue

From 11.00am Saturday 15 November – 3.00am Sunday 16 November 

  • Showground Road from Dawn Fraser Avenue to the Novotel Loading Dock.
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Park Street to Showground Road.

From 10.00pm Saturday 15 November – 1.00am Sunday 16 November 

  • Edwin Flack Avenue from Pondage Link to Old Hill Link (westbound). *Buses excepted.
  • Pondage Link from Hill Road to Edwin Flack Avenue - (Inbound to Sydney Olympic Park only) *Buses excepted.
  • Edwin Flack Avenue (northbound) from Bernie Avenue to Old Hill Link *Buses excepted.
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Park Street to Australia Avenue
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Park Street to Australia Avenue *Buses excepted.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Illawarra Hawks v Melbourne United at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 7.30pm, full time around 9.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to the match in the already busy evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Ricky Martin at Qudos Bank Arena on Monday 10 November. Show starts at 7.30pm and will finish around 10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as concert-goers make their way to Olympic Park is the already busy evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Jelly Roll at Qudos Bank Arena on Tuesday 4 November. Show starts at 7pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd, particularly during the busy evening peak. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Illawarra Hawks v Sydney Kings at WIN Entertainment Centre on Sunday. Tip-off at 2.30pm, full time around 4.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to the match.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Boiler Room at Sydney Showground on Saturday 15 November from 2pm until 11pm.

With a sold out crowd of 10,000 expected, and the Metallica concert with 70,000 fans expected at nearby Accor Stadium, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct.  

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • PARKING: Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space, parking is in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time as traffic will be heavy while other events also take place in the precinct.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park. Opal fares apply.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the match. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.
